p: The secondary-metabolite profiling of methanol and chloroform extracts of M. buxifolia leaves and stems was assessed by utilizing standard reverse-phase (RP)-UHPLC–MS analysis as described previously [ 16]. Similarly, 22 polyphenolic components (gallic acid, catechin, chlorogenic acid, p-OH benzoic acid, vanillic acid, epicatechin, syringic acid, 3-OH benzoic acid, 3-OH-4-MeO benzaldehyde, p-coumaric acid, rutin, sinapinic acid, t-ferullic acid, naringin, 2.3-diMeO benzoic acid, benzoic acid, o-coumaric acid, quercetin, harpagoside, t-cinnamic acid, naringenin, and carvacrol; standards purchased from Sigma Aldrich Milan, Italy) were also determined in extracts using HPLC–PDA analysis following a previously reported protocol [ 15].
